RIs. (Some of them similar to wrong ajax requests)

--- In archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com, Gordon Mohr <gojomo@...> wrote:
>
=
> Without more details of the complaints, it's hard to say.
> <...>but ther=
e are two behaviors which can sometimes cause problems:

> (2) By default, =
Heritrix tries any plausible relative-URI-like String 
> found in certain f=
orm elements and Javascript. This does not result in 
> rapid requests, but=
 can result in a lot of 404's as invalid URIs are 
> tried against a site. =
Toggling some of the settings in ExtractorHTML and 
> ExtractorJS can stop =
Heritrix from trying these URIs -- eliminating many 
> 404s (at the cost of=
 possibly missing some valid URIs).
> 
> With more specifics, I might be ab=
le to make more specific recommendations.
> 
> - Gordon @ IA
